```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(terra)
library(raster)
```

# Most recent version 

This is the most updated version of the IC I was given to use in August:

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
globiom_lc <- rast(
  "../data/initial_lc_globiom/Protection_augmented_ETL2_shares_August_2023.tif")
```

You can see that the marine layers are not where we'd expect...

```{r fig.width=6, fig.height=6}
plot(globiom_lc['Marine'])
```

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.width=4, fig.height=4}
plot(sum(globiom_lc['Marine']), main = "Marine (sum)")
```

And look super similar to the rivers & lakes? 

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.width=4, fig.height=4}
plot(sum(globiom_lc['Rivers']), main = "Rivers & Lakes (sum)")
```

# Previous version

Previous version I was using didn't have the issue -- 

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
globiom_lc_old <- rast(
  "../data/initial_lc_globiom/5arcmin_augmented_ETL2_wprotection_shares 2.tif")
```

Marine was where we would expect
```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.width=6, fig.height=6}
plot(globiom_lc_old['Marine'])
```

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.width=4, fig.height=4}
plot(sum(globiom_lc_old['Marine']),main = "Marine (sum - old version)")
```

As were the rivers and lakes

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.width=4, fig.height=4}
plot(sum(globiom_lc_old['Rivers']), main = "Rivers & Lakes (sum - old version)")
```
